info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 7:21PM EDT until June 17 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, McCreary and Whitley.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsburg, Whitley City, Duckrun, Beulah Heights, Honeybee, Cumberland Falls S.P., Hollyhill, Bounty, Marshes Siding, Krupp, Pine Knot, Stearns, Wiborg, Parkers Lake, Redbird, Strunk, Jellico Creek, Youngs Creek, Greenwood and Clio.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING
